version_description:
Greetings from BananaGlue!
[Added] Better calculation of estimated scan time in case of vpn scanning
[Added] Correct display of scan range if changing network access (wifi/vpn/custom)
[Updated] Vendor and MacModels databases, including newest MacBooks
[Fixed] Correct scan progress display if fast scan is activated
[Fixed] Code optimizations
We did our best to optimize all possible actions, technically and by interface.
Please contact us for suggestions or error reports via mail.
If you like iNet please consider to rate the current version at the App Store.
And as always - have fun!

[Added] New 'Registered Ports' to ports preset lists (Pro-Version)
[Added] Find information via Internet for Ports that are not assigned (Pro-Version)
[Updated] All databases
If you like iNet please consider to rate the current version at the App Store (use the i-Button)
Have a good day!

[Fixed] Some user reported issues
[Updated] Minor changes in descriptions
[Updated] All databases
[Fixed] Code optimizations
If iNet is usefull for you - please consider to rate the current version at the App Store (simply use the i-Button)
Have a good day!

[Added] Redesign for bigger screen sizes
[Added] Newest iPhone models
[Fixed] Some user reported issues
[Updated] Minor changes in descriptions
[Updated] All databases
If you like iNet - please consider to rate the current version at the App Store (simply use the i-Button)
Have a good day!

[Added] Portscan allows now scanning without choosing the standard portlist automatically (Pro)
[Added] New 2016 Macbook Pro models
[Added] Automatically setting correct port range and interface on vpn scanning
[Updated] Minor changes in descriptions
[Updated] All databases
[Fixed] Some Translations
[Fixed] Lot of code optimizations
If you like iNet - please consider to rate the current version at the App Store (simply use the i-Button)
Have a good day!
iOS 10.2 compatibility

[Added] Better detection of devices for adding names or icons.
[Added] Scan engine enhancements
[Updated] All databases
We wish all of you a very good 2017 :-)

[Fixed] Possible crash in scan engine
Thanks for your feedback and your reviews...

[Added] Scan personal hotspot - See which devices are using your iPhone for Internet Access
[Updated] Services database, Vendor database
Thank you for your ratings and reviews :-)

[Updated] Vendor database
[Fixed] Code optimizations
Thank you for all your feedback and reviews ... :-)

[Added] Better detection of hidden devices
[Updated] Vendor and model database
[Fixed] Code optimizations
Please support further development - rate or review iNet :-)

[Fixed] Address resolution if device is announced by a sleep proxy server
[Added] Refined detection of hidden devices
[Added] Show 'Last seen' in additional info list
[Added] Switch to deactivate internet access to search for port definitions
[Added] Refined attribution of standard icons
[Fixed] Ensured that the scan button in portscan section is allways visible
Please support ongoing development - rate or review iNet :-)

[Added] Some interface types
[Fixed] Possible crash in vpn scanning
[Fixed] Some layout glitches

[Updated] Vendor and Mac models databases
[Fixed] Some code enhancements
Please support continuous development by rating iNet at the App Store :-)
[Fixed] Prevent ping error on IPv6 adresses

[Added] iOS 11 compatibility (no access to MAC addresses)
[Added] Special keyboard to support entering Mac addresses manually
[Fixed] A lot of code enhancements

[Fixed] Better ping address resolution (Pro)
[Added] Some layout changes
Have a good day :-)

[Fixed] Animation of scan progress is visible again
[Fixed] Correct positioning of title in scan view

[Added] If you have saved scans before the iOS 11 release, you can now load them with all the information of these scans (MAC addresses, notes, changed names, icons).
Access the old scans by tapping in the network scanner view on the three horizontal bars in the top right corner of the screen.
This may be helpful for some of you to find out especially the MAC addresses of your network ...

The iPhone X is here. So we had a lot fun to optimize the different iNet layouts for the all new much nicer and bigger screen.
And as allways we worked hard to optimize the code base further. Hoping still for Apple to rethink its no-mac-detection decision.

Have a good time ... :-)
[Updated] Network Scan Settings
[Updated] All databases
[Fixed] More iPhone X compatibility

[Fixed] Truncation of IP addresses on iPhone 5
Have a good 2018 ...

[Added] Enhanced Portscan Section (Pro-Version)
Have a good day.
Please support our petition to Apple:
https://www.change.org/p/apple-save-networking-tools-on-ios-11

[Updated] All databases
[Fixed] Search field in Ping section is accessible again (pro)
[Added] Some layout refinements
Please help to convince Apple: https://www.change.org/p/apple-save-networking-tools-on-ios-11

[Updated] All databases
[Fixed] When portscanning use at least the default port list
Please help to convince Apple: https://www.change.org/p/apple-save-networking-tools-on-ios-11

[Added] Newest iPad models
[Added] Some code optimizations
Support continuous development - rate this release of iNet at the App Store :-)
You find a convenient link under the "i" tab.
And - have a good time!
